specialities: There is a basic food supply during the camp with long breakfasts and self-made dinners. Participants are kindly asked to help financially and logistically with food preparation.
cancellation_description: Das Technik-Camp 2020 musste leider abgesagt werden.

label: Linux Bierwanderung
name: Linux Bierwanderung
self_description:
A Linux Bier Wanderung (engl. Linux Beer Hike) is a week-long event typically held in a small town in Europe where a group of like-minded open source enthusiasts gather to share knowledge, hike, enjoy various liquid refreshments (non-alcoholic and alcoholic) and first and foremost have fun! Everybody is expected to look after their own travel logistics including accommodation but the website promoting the event (including this one) typically offers some guidance and provides information about where to look and what to expect. The event is generally free of charge (ie. no registration fee or similar) but the costs of the Hall (rented by the organiser(s) of the event) is shared between the participants. The central purpose of the Hall is to serve as a base camp for the various activities and as a gathering place for meeting, sharing ideas, talks, etc. You can find more details here. There is also a mailing list covering various topics around the LBW and is used for communication between evetns (may require registration).

But back to this year's LBW and its location. With miles of well-kept trails and numerous sites, the Taunus is the ideal location for a week of hiking and other fun activities. Frankfurt with its variety of (craft) beer places is only half an hour away by public transport; Germany's biggest airport is only an hour by train. In addition to these amenities, Kronberg fulfils the following basic LBW rules:

  1. The hamlet must be able to be crossed within a short amount of time either on two or four legs.
  3. One cannot get lost regardless of the state of intoxication.
  4. The location must be remote enough to sever most ties with hipster urbanism.
  5. It must have at least seven establishments which are serving as PotDs during the week.
  6. A hall with decent internet connection and stable power supply is a prerequisite.
entrance_fee: Participants are asked for a donation of ~30 Euro
specialities: In the morning we will usually meet in the hall, which serves as a meeting point for the week. There will likely be notices up for planned walks, excursions, talks, or other events. You can head off on one of these, or relax in the hall. In the evening a pub-of-the-day will be selected, and we will head there for food and drink. This year we have a kitchen in the hall, so cooking together there may well happen.
cancellation_description: Unfortunately, owed to current circumstances, this year's event orignally planned to take place at the end of August in Kronberg, Germany has been cancelled.

label: OpenSym
name: OpenSym
venue: Círculo de Bellas Artes de Madrid
self_description:
The 16th International Symposium on Open Collaboration (OpenSym 2020) is the premier conference on open collaboration research and practice, including open source, open data, open science, open education, wikis and related social media, Wikipedia, and IT-driven open innovation research.

OpenSym is the first conference series to bring together the different strands of open collaboration research and practice, seeking to create synergies and inspire new collaborations between people from computer science, information science, social science, humanities, and everyone interested in understanding open collaboration and how it is changing the world.

OpenSym 2020 will be held at Círculo de Bellas Artes de Madrid in Madrid, Spain on 25-27 August 2020. A Doctoral Consortium will take place on 24 August 2020. Research and community presentations and performances will be accompanied by keynotes, invited speakers, and a social program. The capital of Spain, Madrid is a vibrant city with a rich history with plenty of things to see and do. Madrid is easy to reach with all major airlines.
specialities: A Doctoral Consortium will take place on 24 August 2020.

label: Hacken Open Air
name: Hacken Open Air 2::20
self_description:
Das Hacken Open Air ist feinstes Hacker-Camping, ausgerichtet vom Hackerspace Stratum 0. Wir versammeln uns zum gemütlichen Treffen mit Freunden und Bekannten.

Beim Hacken Open Air geht es um gemeinsames Basteln, Diskutieren und Grillen. Wir verzichten bewusst auf ein von uns organisiertes Vortragsprogramm. Stattdessen lassen wir euch Freiraum für selbstorganisierte Vorträge und Workshops.

Dieses Jahr campen wir am Pfadfinderheim Welfenhof in Gifhorn - 25km nördlich von Braunschweig.
cancellation_description: Wir haben uns schweren Herzens entschieden das HOA 2020 abzusagen. Grund hierfür ist, kurz gesagt, dass wir aktuell nicht zuverlässig für den Termin Ende August planen können. Mit der Absage möchten wir das ändern und Dir und uns Planungssicherheit geben. Die gute Nachricht ist: Wir werden das HOA 2020 einfach nächstes Jahr vom 09.09.2021 bis 12.09.2021 am gleichen Ort nachholen \o/

label: GUADEC
name: GNOME Users And Developers European Conference
self_description: GUADEC is the GNOME community’s largest conference, bringing together hundreds of users, contributors, community members, and enthusiastic supporters together for a week of talks and workshops.Please note: due to the Coronavirus, GUADEC 2020 will be held online, and will return to Mexico in 2021. More details are available in GNOME's Discourse post.
specialities: There will be social events and Social Hours: Every night after the evening social events, you can attend or host a Social Hour. Social hours are a time to get together around any topic you’re interested in. These will include a Tea Party, GNOME Beers, and a GLBTQ+ social time. We especially encourage Social Hours based on non-English languages. If you want to host a social hour, please sign up for an account on and add it to the wiki.

label: Wuthering Bytes
name: Wuthering Bytes
cancellation_description:
It will likely come as no surprise to learn that the festival has been cancelled this year. We had pretty much come to this conclusion just before lockdown and at this point stopped planning. However, for one reason or another hadn’t got round to making an announcement until now.

We do hope that the festival can return in 2021, but suffice to say that we won’t be making any plans until we are fully confident that this will be possible while ensuring the safety of everyone. In the meantime, take care and look out for each other!

label: ActivityPub Conference
name: ActivityPub Conference
self_description:
A conference about the present and future of ActivityPub, the world’s leading federated social web standard.

The 2020 virtual conference will include

  • pre-recorded talks with live question and answer sessions
  • birds of a feather sessions
  • lightning round talks
  • a hackathon that follows the conference.

label: LibreOffice Conference
name: LibreOffice Conference
self_description: Organizers of the openSUSE + LibreOffice Conference, along with the project’s boards, have made the decision to change the conference to an online conference.

label: BalCCon2k20
name: Balkan Computer Congress 2020
self_description:
IMPORTANT UPDATE:

Unfortunately we have decided to cancel Balkan Computer Congress-BalCCon2k20. It was a tough decision. Currently there’s no way to gather everyone together and keep them safe. We had hopes that things would be stable by September. Although the situation is getting better, there is still too much uncertainty. September may still be too early to be so many people gathered in small rooms. We can not imagine BalCCon2k20 with masks and 1.5m distance (just imagine Rakija Leaks ). That would ruin the whole spirit of the conference.

Still we decided not to cancel all events at BalCCon2k20. CTF will take place and we will still make a T-Shirts and sell them. There will be for sure couple more online events during planed dates for BalCCon2k20. Stay tuned!!!

Stay healthy, stay safe, and stay in touch!!! Hope to see you all again at BalCCon2k21!!!

Our major goal is to gather all the communities from the region and abroad so we can socialize, hack, play, learn, exchange knowledge and experience and of course, party together.

BalCCon is community organized and non commercial event - from Hackers to Hackers. We are aiming to become the center of the hacker community in the region as well as to provide an opportunity for all the people in this part of Europe to connect and to cooperate.

Program and speakers will be taken through a Call for Papers few months before the congress. We have planned some special guests whose reputation is well known in the community. All applications sent by people will be stored and graded by congress orga people.

BalCCon is an international conference, therefore your submissions should be in English. It is expected that we will have participants from all over the World, so it is important to have a common language.
specialities: Assembly space, Rakia Leaks

label: End Summer Camp
name: End Summer Camp 2K20
self_description: ESC è un incontro non-profit di persone interessate all'Hacking, al Software Libero e al DIY. Il contenuto dell'evento è in continua evoluzione e viene creato dai suoi partecipanti.

label: Workshop-Tage 2020
name: Workshop-Tage 2020
self_description:
Auch dieses Jahr möchten wir den Track "Big Data & Algorithmic Business" durchführen. Damit soll die Relevanz von Open Source für Themenfelder wie Blockchain, Big Data und Data Analytics, Deep Learning, Cloud und IoT und Process Engineering aufgezeigt werden.

Natürlich sind auch Eingaben zu den angestammten Tracks, insbesondere "Software-Engineering mit Open Source", weiterhin willkommen!

Dazu erhoffen wir uns neue Impulse für die Bereiche Unternehmenskultur und Change Management sowie Agilität im Unternehmen im Track "Methodik & Soft Skills".

label: JoomlaDay Germany
name: JoomlaDay Germany
self_description:
Da man noch nicht absehen kann, ob im September wieder Konferenzen stattfinden dürfen, haben wir uns entschieden eine Online-Konferenz zu veranstalten. Termin: 26.September 2020 (eine Woche später als Bad Hersfeld)

conference from the cms Joomla, but not only for joomla user. Two days conference with many sessions and much time for networking.
main_organiser: Viviana Menzel and Nadja Lamisch, team@joomladay.de

label: FediConf
name: FediConf
self_description:
The FediConf is a place where everyone interested in Free social networks, Descentralized technology and Free software can meet in person, share experiences, concerns, and progress in our fight for a better Internet.

Talks, debates and workshops during one weekend to put in common our interests and doubts, and to learn from each other.

--

La FediConf és un espai de trobada on totes aquelles persones interesades en les Xarxes Socials Lliures, la tecnología descentralitzada i el Software Lliure es poden probar en persona, compartir experiències, preocupacions i progressos en la nostra lluita per un internet millor.

Xerrades, taules de debat i tallers durant un cap de setmana per tal d'aunar interessos comúns, dubtes i aprenentatge.

--

La FediConf es un espacio de encuentro donde todas aquellas personas interesadas en las Redes Sociales Libres, la tecnología descentralizada y el Software Libre se pueden encontrar en persona, compartir experiencias, preocupaciones y progresos en nuestra lucha por un internet mejor.

Charlas, mesas de debate y talleres durante un fin de semana con el objetivo de aunar intereses comunes, dudas y aprendizaje.
cancellation_description: Postponed due to covid-19

label: Percona Live
name: Percona Live
self_description: Percona Live is a community-focused event for database developers, administrators, and decision-makers to network with peers and technology professionals. Come learn from the best and brightest of the open source database community as they share their knowledge, experience, and use cases with you in small group sessions and tutorials.

label: Open Access Barcamp
name: Open Access Barcamp
self_description: Mit dem Barcamp möchten wir Interessierten der Open-Access-Community die Möglichkeit bieten, in den Austausch miteinander zu treten, sich zu vernetzen und voneinander zu lernen. Das Format Barcamp ist im Gegensatz zu klassischen Konferenzen offener und verzichtet auf ein vorgegebenes Programm. Stattdessen können Teilnehmende sich selbstorganisiert zu den für sie spannenden Themen zusammenfinden. Dabei sind alle Themen rund um Open Access willkommen. So könnten z.B. die Umsetzung der DEAL-Verträge, die Verstetigung von Publikationsfonds, Open-Access-Monografien oder Open Access in bestimmten Fachdisziplinen diskutiert werden. Die Teilnehmenden entscheiden selbst, welche Sessions sie anbieten und welche sie besuchen möchten.
cancellation_description:
This event has been cancelled to slow down the spreading of COVID-19 virus. We know this is a big loss for everyone involved, for organisers, speakers, participants, volunteers and also for the budgets.

Our full solidarity and we hope you grow stronger than ever in your next editions <3

label: Open-Access-Tage
name: Open-Access-Tage
self_description:
At home but open - aufgrund der unübersichtlichen Lage in der COVID-19 Pandemie haben wir entschieden, dass die Open-Access-Tage 2020 nicht als Vor-Ort-Veranstaltung in Bielefeld stattfinden werden. Stattdessen wollen wir eine reine Online-Tagung mit Ihnen vorbereiten.

Open Access lebt von den Möglichkeiten des digitalen Austauschs und der räumlichen Unabhängigkeit. Es wird eine spannende Aufgabe, dies auch für unsere Tagung zu erproben. Gleichzeitig möchten wir allen Interessierten die Teilnahme ermöglichen, unabhängig von der Lage im September, von eventuellen Reisebeschränkungen oder der Zugehörigkeit zu einer Risikogruppe.

Die Open-Access-Tage bilden die jährliche zentrale Plattform für die stetig wachsende Open-Access- und Open-Science-Community aus Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz. Erwartet werden rund 400 Teilnehmer*innen hauptsächlich aus Bibliotheken, Forschungsinstituten und Fördereinrichtungen.

label: LinuxDays
name: LinuxDays
self_description: The LinuxDays conference 2020 means two days of talks, workshops, booths of various projects (Fedora, Gentoo, Slax, openSUSE, vpsFree.cz, Python, Mozilla, brmlab, OpenAlt etc.), electronics ham-shack for children, lots of interesting people and lot of new information. Although the event is primarily held in the Czech language, there will be talks in English as well. The event is free of charge.

label: PyConES
name: PyConES Granada 2020
venue: Campus de la Salud - Universidad de Granada
self_description: PyConES es la conferencia de la comunidad Python española. PyConES se celebrará por séptima vez del 02 al 04 de octubre de 2020 en Granada, tras siete exitosas ediciones en Madrid, Zaragoza, Valencia, Almería, Cáceres, Málaga y Alicante, siguiendo el formato del evento mundial de PyCon.
cancellation_description: Ante la gravedad de las noticias sobre el coronavirus que estamos viviendo estos días y después de barajar múltiples posibilidades la organización de PyConES de este año ha decidido posponer el evento a otoño de 2021.

label: Sonoj Convention
name: Sonoj Convention
self_description: The Sonoj Convention is an annual event in Cologne, Germany about music production with free and open source software. It features demonstrations, talks and hands-on workshops. Meet like-minded people, learn insider knowledge and tricks, participate in our one-hour production challenge!
cancellation_description: The Sonoj Convention 2020 is cancelled. The Corona-virus does not allow it and there will be no later date and no online replacement. 2021 will be announced around February. In the meantime please visit the Sonoj Archive to read about past conventions.

label: FOSSCOMM
name: Free and Open Source Software Communities Meeting
self_description:
The Free and Open Source Software Communities Meeting or otherwise FOSSCOMM aims at all Free and Open Source Software enthusiasts, regardless of the knowledge level that they own at this field. From the first conference held in 2008 at the National Technical University of Athens until today, the conference’s aspiration is to showcase the usefulness and the necessity of using Free and Open Source Software and to point out new trends in it thus attracting new members to the communities, aiming at the contribution of more and more free software for all.

Due to the recent health crisis because of COVID-19, this year’s FOSSCOMM 2020, will take place via Web and will be organizationally supported by the IEEE Student Branch of the University of Western Macedonia.
main_organiser: IEEE Student Branch of the University of Western Macedonia

label: DINAcon
name: DINAcon
self_description: DINAcon goes Digital! Auch in diesem Jahr lädt die DINAcon ein, Session-Vorschläge zu konkreten Themen rund um digitale Nachhaltigkeit einzureichen. Vereine, Communites, Non-Profit-Organisationen, aber auch Unternehmen und öffentliche Stellen sind willkommen, unser Programm mitzugestalten. Die DINAcon Konferenz wird in diesem Jahr nicht wie vorerst geplant live, sondern als digital Event stattfinden.
specialities: DINACon Awards

label: GNU/LinuxDay – Vorarlberg
name: GNU/LinuxDay – Vorarlberg
venue: Höhere Technische Lehr- und Versuchsanstalt Dornbirn
self_description:
Der diesjährige LinuxDay findet am 10. Oktober statt. Veranstaltungsort ist wie üblich die HTL Dornbirn. Organisiert wird das Event alljährlich im Herbst von der Linux User Group Vorarlberg, der Eintritt ist frei.

In mehreren parallelen Vortragsreihen geht es um verschiedenste Themen rund um Open Source.

Die Zielgruppe der Veranstaltung ist breit gefächert, Tüftler und Heimanwender kommen genauso auf ihre Kosten wie System-Administratoren und Software-Entwickler.

Ergänzend zu den Vorträgen gibt es einen Ausstellerbereich mit Informations-Ständen von international bekannten Projekten, Firmen und regionalen Communities. Sie ermöglichen das Knüpfen von Kontakten und geben Einblick in aktuelle Entwicklungen.

Den ganzen Tag über stehen Probier-PCs mit gängigen Linux-Distributionen bereit.

Ein Restaurant mit günstigen Preisen lädt zum Fachsimpeln und zum Verweilen ein.
specialities: Den ganzen Tag über stehen Probier-PCs mit gängigen Linux-Distributionen bereit.

label: ApacheCon
name: ApacheCon
self_description:
Coming to your living room this September!

Join us from the comfort of your own home for three days of Apache project content across dozens of categories, from Big Data to Machine Learning to Search to Web Frameworks and more.

label: T-Dose
name: T-Dose
self_description: T-DOSE is a free and yearly event held in The Netherlands to promote use and development of Open Source Software. During this event, Open Source projects, developers and visitors can exchange ideas and knowledge.

label: NixCon
name: NixCon 2020
self_description:
NixCon is a community-oriented conference for contributors and users of Nix and NixOS. It's about sharing experiences, inspiring people and discussing future development.

We would like to learn about how you use Nix and NixOS in your organization and what you are currently working on.

The growth of NixOS as a project brings its own challenges and we would like to know how you think the user experience can be improved and how NixOS can be scaled.

label: Open Source Summit + Embedded Linux Conference Europe
name: Open Source Summit + Embedded Linux Conference Europe

label: EmacsConf
name: EmacsConf
self_description:
EmacsConf is the conference about the joy of Emacs, Emacs Lisp, and memorizing key sequences.

We are busy putting things together for EmacsConf 2020, and we need your help to make EmacsConf 2020 amazing, much like the previous EmacsConfs. See our Call for Proposals, get involved, and help spread the word!

We are holding EmacsConf 2020 as a virtual (online) conference again this year, especially now, given the current state of the world with the ongoing global pandemic. We remain fully committed to freedom, and we will continue using our infrastructure and streaming setup consisting entirely of free software, much like the last EmacsConf.

Come hang out with us in #emacsconf on chat.freenode.net. You can join the chat using your favourite IRC client, or by visiting chat.emacsconf.org in your web browser, a self-hosted instance of The Lounge free software web IRC client for EmacsConf.
technical_liberties: Green: Users can access all content and fully participate in an online event by using foss software only and the backend is using foss software only as well

label: OpenFest
name: OpenFest
self_description:
OpenFest is the biggest Bulgarian conference dedicated to the free culture, free knowledge sharing, free and open source software. It is the most anticipated annual gathering of fans, creators and supporters of the open source and free art in Bulgaria.

The purpose of OpenFest is to promote projects created with free and open software and to provide a forum for exchanging ideas and best practices in the field. Themes related to the free/open art also have their reserved spot in the festival’s program.

The slogan of OpenFest is "Let’s share the freedom!"

label: Promcon
name: Promcon
self_description:
PromCon Online 2020 is the fifth installment of the PromCon conference dedicated to the Prometheus monitoring system. It will take place online on July 14-16, 2020 (Tue - Thu).

PromCon aims to connect Prometheus users and developers from around the world in order to exchange knowledge, best practices, and experience gained around using Prometheus. We also want to collaborate to build a community and grow professional connections around systems and service monitoring."

label: OSHWDem
name: Open Source Hardware Demonstration
self_description:
Sí makers y amantes de las Tecnologías Libres, aceptamos el reto de realizar una edición adaptada a las circunstancias, porque aún en la distancia queremos veros y sentiros cerca. Así que este año la OSHWDem será en formato online el 7 de noviembre.

Le hemos dado muchas vueltas y si bien las circunstancias no están dadas para hacer de manera responsable la OSHWDem que a todos nos gusta y a la que estamos acostumbrados, aceptamos el desafío de hacerlo posible, porque, ocasiones de hacer una edición especial online como esta hay muy pocas. Así que echemos mano de ingenio y mantengamos vivo el espíritu que nos define en esta edición tan peculiar.

Esta novena entrega nos llena de orgullo y será un auténtico reto, pero así somos los makers, resolvemos problemas por diversión, cada edición tiene nuevos retos que superar y crece la dificultad pero solo si contamos con el gran apoyo que siempre nos ha brindado la comunidad maker, lo lograremos. ¿Somos makers o gallinas?

Saquemos brillo a las fortalezas con las que contamos ante esta adversidad y sigamos adelante con esta fiesta, la tecnología será la gran protagonista más que nunca en esta edición, en la exaltación de lo libre y abierto, donde la documentación cobrará especial relevancia siendo el principal medio con el que contaremos para poder palpar los proyectos. No olvidemos que la comunidad maker ha sido una gran protagonista en los últimos sucesos, tenéis muchas aventuras que contar, grandes vivencias que compartir y queremos ser como otra veces ese espacio de encuentro.

Para los que aún no la conocéis, la OSHWDem es un evento de tecnología única, abierto a todos los públicos, que acoge cada año un número creciente de proyectos libres que sus creadores exponen al público asistente en un ambiente cercano y amistoso, pero este año debemos dar el ejemplo de responsabilidad y compromiso predicando con el ejemplo, queremos mantener la cercanía, la calidez y eso solo es posible en estos momentos con la ayuda de la tecnología, la OSHWDem en su versión más 2D.

Sin makers no hay OSHWDem, así que estad atentos a los anuncios porque empezamos enseguida. Como todos los años, poco después de este anuncio lanzaremos el llamamiento a makers. Si tienes un proyecto anímate a presentarlo, organizaremos diferentes formatos de actividades online, aún tienes tiempo de pulir, documentar o incluso empezar desde cero. Contaremos más detalles en el siguiente post.

Si tienes cualquier duda, podemos ayudarte. Contacta con nosotros a través del correo info@oshwdem.org.

label: Linux App Summit
name: Linux App Summit
self_description:
Applications are the foundation of the user experience and can be appreciated in all types of Linux environments. It is this reason that building a common app ecosystem is a valuable goal. At the Linux Application Summit (LAS), we will collaborate on all aspects aimed at accelerating the growth of the Linux application ecosystem.

At LAS you can attend talks, panels, and Q&As on a wide range of topics covering everything. From creating, packaging, and distributing apps, to monetization within the Linux ecosystem, designing beautiful applications, and more - all delivered by the top experts in each field. You will acquire insights into how to reach users, build a community around your app, what toolkits and technologies make development easier, which platforms to aim for, and much more.

LAS welcomes application developers, designers, product managers, user experience specialists, community leaders, academics, and anyone who is interested in the state of Linux application design and development!

label: SFScon
name: South Tyrol Free Software Conference
self_description:
A conference all about Free Software: The South Tyrol Free Software Conference, SFScon, is one of Europe’s most established annual conferences on Free Software. SFScon promotes the use of Free Software in IT infrastructures as a tool to achieve greater innovation and competitiveness in the region. Here decision-makers and developers meet, learn and get inspired.

This year SFScon will take place in blended mode: both online and at NOI Techpark, for a limited number of people. The priority will be given to speakers and sponsors. If circumstances change, we will revert to online only participation.
specialities: South Tyrol Free Software Award

label: FIfFKon
name: FIfFKon
self_description:
Die COVID-19-Pandemie wird auch Auswirkungen auf die diesjährigen FIfF-Konferenz haben. Sie soll am Samstag, 14. November und Sonntag, 15. November 2020 als Videostream/Videokonferenz stattfinden; detaillierte Informationen werden wir laufend auf 2020.fiffkon.de bereitstellen.

Das Programm ist in Vorbereitung. Freut Euch auf Vorträge von Zinalda Berenson, Stephan Wiefling und weiteren ReferentInnen. Dazu werden wir den diesjährigen Weizenbaum-Studienpreis verleihen und Rückschau auf das FIfF-Jahr halten. Auch die Mitgliederversammlung ist Teil des Programms.

Die Konferenz wird als Online Videokonferenz mit BigBlueButton durchgeführt und aufgezeichnet. Interessierte/Teilnehmende können sich in Kürze registrieren und erhalten den Link zur Konferenz einen Tag vorher an die angegebene Emailadresse zugesandt.
editions_topic: Mit dem Wissen wächst der Zweifel
technical_liberties: Green: Users can access all content and fully participate in an online event by using foss software only and the backend is using foss software only as well

label: GNU Health Con
name: GNU Health Conference 2020
self_description:
GHCon is an annual conference that brings together enthusiasts and developers of the Libre Health & Hospital Information System.

During the two-day conference, you’ll have the opportunity to attend different thematic sessions and free workshops, share experiences, learn about and discuss implementation cases and, of course, network with GNU Health community members from around the world!

Day 1 (Friday): XIII International Workshop on eHealth in Emerging Economies (IWEEE). IWEEE is about Social Medicine and trying to improve the lives of the underpriviled, and the workshops will provide the opportunities for open discussions, networking, and sharing of experiences from different organizations around the World.

Day 2 (Saturday): GNU Health. In the conference's thematic talks, we’ll present and discuss, among other things, upcoming features, standards, security, mobile applications, and implementation cases. Afterwards, in the evening, we'll announce and honor the winners of the GNU Health Social Medicine awards.

We are counting on you and on your active participation to get the most out of the conference. Most importantly, we want you to have fun, feel at home, and enjoy being part of the GNU Health community!

Looking forward to meeting you!

label: Open Source and Linux Day
name: Open Source and Linux Day Villach
self_description:
Neben dem geplanten Rahmenprogramm, wie zum Beispiel der Preisverleihung zur 1. Villacher Hacking-Challenge, wollen wir einen diesen Tag mit Vorträgen und Workshops für alle Teilnehmer zu einem besonderen Erlebnis werden lassen.

source
cancellation_description: Aufgrund der Hygienebestimmungen für Schulen musste der Open Source & Linux Day für 2020 leider abgesagt werden!

label: DjangoCon Europe
name: DjangoCon Europe
self_description:
DjangoCon Europe is a five-day international conference for the community by the community about the Django web framework, held each year in Europe.

This is the 12th edition of the DjangoCon Europe conference, made up of Django practitioners from all levels. We welcome people from all over the world. Our conference seeks to educate and develop new skills, best practices and ideas for the benefit of attendees, developers, speakers and everyone in our global Django Community, not least those watching the talks online.

label: eLife Innovation Sprint
name: eLife Innovation Sprint 2020
self_description: A collaborative hackathon where we bring together talents in UX, software and web development, data science, product, policy, community management and research to develop open tech prototypes to help redefine the ways we share and do research.
registration: yes – Call for project (apply to lead a project) open until April 13; application for project contributors will open April 27 to May 24.

label: DiVOC
name: Hidden Service – Ein digital verteiltes Online Chaos
self_description:
April 2020, hackerspaces everywhere are closed, and all events cancelled. Chaos is disappearing from shared spaces, workshops and craft corners, and retreats into the living room.

The community can only stay visible through the hidden hero of Chaos: the infrastructure. Mostly ignored and assumed to be a given, the decentralized, non-commercial, and tracking-free services allow Chaos to continue to be Chaos. These otherwise hidden services become more visible than ever. Video and audio conference systems allow hackspaces to be transferred to the virtual realm; pads, gits, and wikis enable us to continue to work together. It's time to stay home, but no time to go into hiding.
specialities:
There are so-called self-organized session: "Unter diesem Label sollen Workshops, Gesprächsrunden und alles was euch sonst noch in den Sinn kommt stattfinden. Eigentlich leben diese Sessions von persönlichem Kontakt, welcher sich in Quarantäne-Zeiten leider schwierig gestaltet. Lasst uns also gemeinsam herausfinden, wie sich das am besten in digitale Formate umbauen lässt.

Wir schlagen vor, dafür die digitalen Videokonferenzdienste zu nutzen, die bereits vorhanden sind (am besten natürlich Open Source), und sie auf Herz und Nieren zu testen. In unserem How-To findet ihr eine Liste von Angeboten, schaut sie euch durch und überlegt, worauf ihr Lust habt!"

After the talks there will be music in the stream at night.

"
editions_topic: Hidden Service - Ein Digital Verteiltes Online-Chaos

label: WirVsVirus
name: WirVsVirus – Der Hackathon der Bundesregierung
self_description:
48 hours. Challenges identified by the German federal government and society. You and possibly 80 million other people. The Covid-19 crisis. A wide variety of solutions.

Contribute your skills as we develop solutions from society for society.
specialities: All projects have to be published as FOSS.

label: VenceAlVirus
name: VenceAlVirus – Una respuesta al COVID-19
self_description: Nos enfrentamos a la crisis del Covid-19 confinados en nuestros hogares, pero con una herramienta poderosa en nuestras manos: la interconexión. Hemos organizado el hackathon virtual #VenceAlVirus porque queremos involucrar a toda la inteligencia colectiva de la Comunidad de Madrid en esta causa. Ante la situación crítica que vivimos, buscamos sumar diferentes capacidades para generar dinámicas que ayuden a reforzar el sistema inmunitario social y ser, en definitiva, un revulsivo y una luz en este momento tan duro para muchas personas. Como gran puesta en común, #VenceAlVirus quiere articular soluciones prácticas para el ahora y también para el después. Ponemos este motor en marcha para que los ciudadanos, universitarios, investigadores, innovadores y la sociedad en general que se sumen a la convocatoria puedan trabajar juntos en tiempo real, con un esquema organizado de filtro y definición de las propuestas.
specialities: The event is organized with the help of FOSS. Candidates get a selection bonus if they use FOSS licenses for theit project.

label: foss-north 2020 take II
name: foss-north 2020 take II
self_description: foss-north is a free / open source conference covering both software and hardware from the technical perspective. Hosted in Gothenburg between Copenhagen, Oslo, and Stockholm, with an international airport, we provide a meeting place for the Nordic foss communities and will bring together great speakers with a great audience.

label: Art Meets Radical Openness
name: Art Meets Radical Openness 2020
self_description:
AMRO - Art Meets Radical Openness
Festival dedicated to Art, Hacktivism and Open Culture

Art Meets Radical Openness" brings together local and international artists, activists, developers, researchers and hacktivists involved with the culture of sharing and communal production. They are catalysts that spark new discourses and open up new directions of thinking. Free Open Source Software, open tools in general and the use of free licenses are the precondition and basis for the digital practice of a community like this, which impels social transformation. This tangible transformation goes beyond a digital practice and also changes our real life.

AMRO has its roots in the successful Free Software movement of the early 2000s. In conjunction with the Austrian-wide initiative Linux Weeks, servus.at was a co-organizer from the beginning with an event in Linz (LiWoLi – "Linux Weeks Linz"). The cultural, artistic and socio-political focus of the association, which is still marked by the spirit of the Free Software movement, has been systematically expanded with a new cooperation partner. The Kunstuniversität Linz with the Department "Time-Based Media" supports the successful event since 2008. Social, societal and political aspects arising from the pervasion of technology in everyday life were shifted into the foreground.

The Principles of openness and freedom - applied to art and culture - led to the new Title for the event: Art Meets Radical Openness. When art meets radical openness, this suggests a paradox. For what is generally considered contemporary art is rarely ""radically open"" in the sense that their authors consciously use sources, processes and content to further processing, as is the case with F/LOSS projects (Free/libre Open Source software) is common. What can be successful in the development of free software, however, represents a challenge for us in dealing with information. Which information is meaningful and should be made available to whom in what form?

"
specialities:
Happens biennial only.

Is a mixed festival of art and hacktivism and open culture.

Offers a virtual festival like experience including stages, exhibition, foodcorner and patio.
online_interactivity: Workshops will be taking place in BBB.
technical_liberties: Full freedom possible. Participants can access the spot with their browser and the workshop backend is realised with the use of Big Blue Button.

label: FrOSCon
name: Free and Open Source Software Conference
self_description:
Come on, let's go virtual.

FrOSCon is a big event. Such events will not be possible for an unforeseeable span of time. Even if the current situation will relax until the traditional FrOSCon weekend in the end of August, no carefree attendance would be possible. We care about the well-being of our visitors and speakers.

Such we decided to move the 15th edition of FrOSCon to the virtual space. The conference will happen as an online event. We will provide more information and publish an adapted Call for Papers soon.

label: OW2online’20
name: OW2online’20
self_description:
OW2online’20, this year's virtual conference, will bring together experts from around the world who focus on open source software and its role in modern corporate information systems.

The central theme of OW2con this year is: "Keep the conversation going!". This background theme refers to the challenges appearing today for decision makers who consider evolving their information systems with open source software. As open source has become mainstream it is not limited to the operating systems and infrastructure middleware. Open source software across the whole information system is what we call "full stack open source". What is at stake is more than just deploying Linux servers; it is about defining an architecture, engaging with the whole open source ecosystem and establishing a mature governance system.
editions_topic: The Challenges of Full Stack Open Source
online_interactivity: Speakers are available for Q&A during and after their talk
technical_liberties:
• Broadcast happens via proprietary platform (Youtube Live)
  • Participants can participate with a browser only.

label: OSS2020
name: The 16th International Conference on Open Source Systems
self_description:
OSS 2020 will be a forum to discuss theories, practices, experiences, and tools on development and applications of OSS systems, with specific focus on two aspects: (a) the development of open source systems and the underlying technical, social, and economics issue (b) the adoption of OSS solutions and the implications of such adoption both in the public and private sectors.

The conference is also meant to provide information and education to practitioners, identify directions for further research, and to be an ongoing platform for technology transfer.
technical_liberties: Participants have to install proprietary software (Zoom)

label: Open Expo Virtual Experience
name: Open Expo Virtual Experience
self_description:
We are pleased to announce you that from June 17th to 21st you can be part of a unique event: OpenExpo Virtual Experience.

This initiative arises after the enormous success of our online activities within Innovation, Digital Transformation and Open Source, in which topics such as have been discussed Cybersecurity, Blockchain, IA, Virtual Reality, IoT, Big Data, … In addition to this, the good acceptance that other virtual events such as Red Hat Summit or Open Source Summit North America are having.

You will be able to enjoy more than 50 activities from technology and innovaton professionals, with the aim of promoting the ecosystem and generating networking.
participants_last_time: First time online. Last time offline: 3500
specialities: Fireside Chats

label: Xen Developer & Design Summit
name: Xen Developer & Design Summit
self_description:
The Xen Project Developer and Design Summit brings together the Xen Project’s community of developers and power users for their annual developer conference. The conference is about sharing ideas and the latest developments, sharing experience, planning, collaboration and above all to have fun and to meet the community that defines the Xen Project.

As we shift from physical to virtual, you will have the ability to collaborate with the Xen community – to share best practices and innovate together. Attend presentations with live Q&A, attend our Design Sessions, and much more!

label: WordCamp Europe
name: WordCamp Europe 2020
self_description:
Now in its 8th year, WordCamp Europe is an informal, community-organised gathering of WordPress enthusiasts – from casual users to Core developers – where we discuss all things WordPress, share ideas and get to know each other.

What is WordCamp Europe Online?

This year, we are making history by hosting WordCamp Europe 2020 Online – the first ever fully virtual WCEU.
specialities: There is a "Contributor Day" for participants to get in touch with each other and without presentations.
online_interactivity: There are Q&A sessions with speakers and network-rooms.

label: Pass the SALT
name: Pass the SALT 2020
self_description:
Dedicated to Free Software and Security.
Free as in free beer and as in Freedom.
English spoken conference.
3 days of talks & workshops. Lille, France.

This edition will be done remotely under a webinar format roughly at the same dates, June 29 - July 1.

Obviously, there will be only talks and no workshop. Sorry for that.
main_organiser: Pass the Salt, Security and Libre Talks

label: leHack
name: le Hack 2020
self_description:
LeHACK is new because it's its second edition but the people behind it being the same that organized the 'Nuit du Hack' event during more than fifteen years. The name changes, our values stay the same !

LeHACK 2020 is a yearly rendezvous where hackers and afficionados are meeting around with both technical and non-technical talks and workshops about hacking. It is a great place to discover, to learn, to teach and be taught in the magical city of Paris.

LeHACK 2020 will be held in La Cite des Sciences, Paris (France) on the 26th and 27th of June 2020.
main_organiser: Same organisers as Nuit du Hack : )
cancellation_description:
leHACK will respawn in June 2021, we tried our best, but there is simply
too much uncertainty about the sanitary situation right now. Stay tuned!

label: State of the Source Summit
name: State of the Source Summit
self_description:
A World-wide Open Source Summit: Build your local community, while engaging the global community.

The State of the Source Summit invites open source communities of practice from around the world to organize and contribute to a global conversation on the current state of open source software: non-technical issues that foster development and community, the licenses that enable collaboration, the practices that promote contribution, and the issues confronting cooperation.

State of the Source is an innovative program that follows the sun around the globe with regional projects, and communities in every timezone creating and delivering content relative to local open source issues and interests, while engaging with an international audience of peers.

Start:

  • Palo Alto CA, USA, 2:00 PM PDT (2100 UTC), Wednesday, September 9th, 2020
  • Wellington NZ, 9:00 AM NZST (2100 UTC), Thursday, September 10th, 2020

End:

  • Palo Alto CA, USA, 2:30 PM PDT (2130 UTC), Thursday, September 10th, 2020
  • Wellington NZ, 9:30 AM NZST (2130 UTC), Friday, September 11th, 2020

label: KDE Akademy
name: KDE Akademy
self_description:
Akademy is the annual world summit of KDE, one of the largest Free Software communities in the world. It is a free, non-commercial event organized by the KDE Community.

The conference is expected to draw hundreds of attendees from the global KDE Community to discuss and plan the future of the Community and its technology. Many participants from the broad free and open source software community, local organizations and software companies will also attend.

Akademy features a 2-day conference with presentations on the latest KDE developments, followed by 5 days of workshops, Birds of a Feather (BoF) and coding sessions. It is an opportunity to meet key KDE contributors, learn about the latest features and enjoy the great atmosphere. You will meet developers, artists, translators, upstream and downstream maintainers, users, and free and open software industry leaders from all over the world.

Akademy 2020 will be held online - 4th-11th September

label: Ich liebe die Logik & die Logik liebt mich
name: Ich liebe die Logik & die Logik liebt mich
self_description:
Eine Ausstellung von @Mondstern bei Topio - public space for Privacy in der Arminiusmarkthalle in Berlin Moabit. In seiner künstlerischen Arbeit dreht sich alles um freie Open-Source Anwendungen. In kleinen, bunten, quadratischen Bildern malt er die vielfältige Welt der Apps aus dem F-Droid Store oder der Entwicklungsplattform Codeberg.Mit seiner Arbeit fokussiert er den Blick auf die freie Opensource Software-Szene.

Vernissage: 28.08.2020, 18h. Die Ausstellung ist Paralell zum Kunstfestival Ortstermin auch am 29 und 30 August zu besichtigen.

label: PyConES
name: PyConES Granada 2020
self_description: La octava edición de la PyConES se celebrará durante el día 3 de Octubre de 2020 como un evento en línea.

label: esLibre
name: esLibre 2020 – Edición Virtual
self_description:
(ES) esLibre es un encuentro de personas interesadas en las tecnologías libres y cultura abierta, enfocado a compartir conocimiento y experiencia alrededor de las mismas. El software libre es la temática central de esLibre. Alrededor de ella, también se contemplan otras tecnologías libres (por ejemplo, hardware libre), y el mundo menos tecnológico del conocimiento libre. En líneas generales, temas relacionados directamente con obras (software, hardware, obras culturales, etc.) que se distribuyan con licencias libres, según la definición de OSI de open source o la definición de la FSF de software libre, o que cumplan la definición de obra cultural libre se considera que encajan perfectamente en esLibre.

(EN) esLibre is a meeting of people interested in free technologies and open culture, focused on sharing knowledge and experience around them. Free software is the central theme of esLibre. Around it, other free technologies are also contemplated (for example, free hardware), and the less technological world of free knowledge. In general terms, topics directly related to works (software, hardware, cultural works, etc.) that are distributed with free licenses, according to the OSI definition of open source or the FSF definition of free software, or that comply with the definition free cultural works are considered to be a perfect fit in esLibre.

    • "Haskell": https://propuestas.eslib.re/2020/salas/katas-programacion-haskell
